snippet: On the eve of Martin Luther King’s Birthday, protesters mobilized by the shooting deaths of young blacks and angry about racial inequality are evoking his work, denouncing what they say is an attempt to sanitize his message.
abstract: Protesters angry over shooting deaths of young black men are evoking work of Rev Dr Martin Luther King Jr on eve of his birthday, in hopes of sparking transformative protest movement; some say that radical nature of King's work has been sanitized, and that radical action is necessary to fight racial inequality; question remains as to whether protesters can built movement similar to King's in vastly different times.
lead_paragraph: On the eve of Martin Luther King’s Birthday, protesters mobilized by the shooting deaths of young blacks and angry about racial inequality are evoking his work, denouncing what they say is an attempt to sanitize his message.

headline.main: Protesters Out to Reclaim King’s Legacy, but in Era That Defies Comparison
headline.print_headline: Protesters Out to Reclaim King’s Legacy, but in Era That Defies Comparison
